metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8366 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Array index error in smal_decode_segment function in LibRaw before 0.17.1allows context-dependent attackers to cause memory errors and possiblyexecute arbitrary code via vectors related to indexes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
